title: Fuel prices reduced from tonight: CPC
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) today announced a reduction in fuel prices, effective from midnight today.

title: Under-18 Elite Rugby Sevens 2025: Wesley stamp their class
byline: Wesley College was in supreme form, defeating D.S. Senanayake College 19-12 in the Cup final at the All Island Under-18 Elite Rugby Sevens 2025, which concluded at Bogambara Stadium in Kandy.

title: Thousands in Australia march against immigration
byline: Thousands of Australians joined anti-immigration rallies across the country on Sunday that the centre-left government condemned, saying they sought to spread hate and were linked to neo-Nazis.

title: Govt may seek foreign expertise to resolve Nilwala salinity barrier issue: Minister Handunnetti
byline: Minister Sunil Handunnetti says the government will seek foreign assistance to find a permanent solution to the problems caused by the irregular construction of the salinity barrier on the Nilwala River in Matara if local technical expertise proves inadequate.

title: September fuel price revision to be announced tonight: CPC
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) announced that the fuel price revision for September will be released tonight.

title: World’s first gene-edited horses are shaking up the genteel sport of polo
byline: They look like ordinary foals, docile with honey brown coats and white facial patches, content to spend their days munching alfalfa in a cordoned-off pasture in rural Buenos Aires province.

title: Five organised criminals detained for 72-hour under PTA
byline: The five organised criminals arrested in Jakarta, Indonesia, are being detained for 72 hours under the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), Police  said.

title: Head-on crash between police van and prison bus kills 14 in Namibia
byline: A head-on collision in Namibia involving vehicles belonging to the security services killed 14 people, including 11 members of the prison service, a police officer and two civilians.

title: Efforts underway to accelerate education reforms, foster entrepreneurship: Govt.
byline: Sri Lanka will accelerate education reforms and foster innovation to prepare the economy for rapid technological and structural change, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said last week, pledging a policy environment that supports startups and attracts investment.

title: External sector momentum continues in July
byline: Sri Lanka’s external sector surged in July 2025, with record merchandise exports, strong remittance inflows, and rising tourism earnings fuelling consecutive current account surpluses.

title: Three women abused at parlour, constable caught after fall
byline: A police constable was injured after a fall while attempting to flee the scene of an alleged sexual abuse at a massage parlour in Borella.

title: Case against alleged tsunami jail breakers taken up after 21 years
byline: The case against 56 prisoners who attempted to escape during the tsunami disaster that caused much havoc in the country on December 26, 2004 was taken up before Galle High Court Judge Purnima Paranagama.

title: Funeral parlour employees go on robbery spree with corpses
byline: In an interesting turn of events, an employee of a funeral parlour in Nawalapitiya and another who parked a hearse with a body on board near business establishments had broken open them and taken away cash and valuables.

title: Crucial to safeguard Central Bank Independence - CBSL Chief
byline: Sri Lanka’s future economic stability depends on protecting the independence of its Central Bank, Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe said, warning that political interference had left the country vulnerable to its worst financial collapse in 2022.

title: Saman Ekanayake informed not to appear before CID
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has reportedly informed former Presidential Secretary Saman Ekanayake that he is not required to appear before the CID today, as previously scheduled.

title: Govt. vows full probe into political links with underworld
byline: The police have commenced questioning five organized criminals including Kehelbaddara Padme, following their extradition to Sri Lanka from Indonesia, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: University of Wolverhampton says invitations sent to RW was official
byline: Secretary of the University of Wolverhampton Christine Fraser, in a letter addressed to the office of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, has confirmed that Mr. Wickremesinghe and his spouse were officially invited to the event held in 2023.

title: Two Israeli nationals released after alleged assault on hotel owner and wife in Arugam Bay
byline: Two Israeli nationals who were arrested by Pottuvil Police on Friday (29) for allegedly assaulting a hotel owner and his wife in Arugam Bay, were released on bail.

title: Youth violence linked to social media: Doctors warn
byline: Social media is pushing more young people toward violent behavior, Karapitiya Teaching Hospital consultant psychiatrist Dr. Rumi Ruban said.

title: Seat belts made mandatory for all expressway passengers from today
byline: Wearing seat belts has been made compulsory for all passengers traveling in vehicles on expressways from today, the National Council for Road Safety said.

title: At least 20 killed and dozens more feared dead in Afghanistan quake
byline: A 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit Afghanistan’s eastern region near the Pakistan border on Sunday, according to the United States Geological Survey (USGS).

title: Grama Niladhari remanded for soliciting bribe
byline: A Grama Niladhari officer attached to the Siyambalanduwa area was ordered to be remanded till September 12 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: Earthquake in eastern Afghanistan kills more than 600, injures 1,500
byline: A strong earthquake in eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border has destroyed numerous villages and and caused extensive damage, killing at least 622 people and injuring at least 1,500 others, authorities said on Monday.

title: Ranil thanks everyone who backed him during his arrest
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, in a short special statement, thanked everyone including online media channels who backed him during his recent arrest.

title: President to open new projects in Jaffna, including International Cricket Stadium
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to open several major development projects in Jaffna today, including the commencement of construction on the long-awaited Jaffna International Cricket Stadium.

title: No revision in bus fares despite fuel price drop
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) today announced that bus fares will remain unchanged despite the latest reduction in fuel prices.

title: Govt. explores action to recover encroached Kandy hospital lands
byline: The Ministry of Health has raised concern over the large-scale encroachment of land belonging to the Kandy National Hospital, with nearly half of its property occupied by unauthorized settlers.

title: SL will go bankrupt again in 2028: Sajith
byline: Sri Lanka will go bankrupt again in 2028 as it has failed to maintain adequate economic growth to earn the USD 5.5 billion needed to repay loans annually from 2028, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Hamas spokesman Abu Obeida killed in Gaza, Israel says
byline: Abu Obeida, the spokesman for Hamas’s armed wing, has been killed in an aerial attack in Gaza City, Israel has said.

title: “I am free now,” says Harak Kata
byline: Notorious underworld figure Nadun Chinthaka Wickremeratne, alias Harak Kata, told reporters outside court that he is “a free boy now.”

title: President assures to release every plot of land in North acquired by security forces
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that every plot of land in the North, which was acquired for the security forces during the war, will be released back to the people.

title: Supreme Court allows FR petition against Ranil, others
byline: The Supreme Court today granted leave to proceed with a Fundamental Rights petition filed by the Centre for Environmental Justice against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and several others.

title: Committee to ensure safety of food and beverages in Parliament
byline: A Committee has been appointed by the House Committee, presided over by Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne for the purpose of presenting proposals with regard to enhancing the safety of food and beverages in Parliament.

title: Gammanpila petitions court from Thailand over possible CID arrest
byline: Former Parliamentarian Udaya Gammanpila, who is currently in Thailand, has filed a writ petition through his lawyer seeking an order preventing his arrest by the CID in connection with a statement he made to a Sinhala newspaper regarding the arrest of former Navy Commander Admiral Nishantha Ulugetenne.

title: IGP orders CID to take action over fake image
byline: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya has directed the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to launch an investigation and initiate legal action against those responsible for circulating a doctored image of Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala.

title: Boy dies after falling into unprotected well
byline: A six-year-old boy died after falling into an unprotected well in the Pathiranegama area of Polpithigama.

title: Record prize money revealed for Women’s Cricket World Cup
byline: With less than a month until the start of the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025, the International Cricket Council have announced a staggering increase in the prize money for the tournament set to be staged in India and Sri Lanka.

title: PM Modi hitches ride with Putin after SCO
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday travelled in the same car to the destination of their bilateral meeting after the proceedings at the SCO Summit venue in Tianjin, China-- a visual statement amid US President Donald Trump’s tariff onslaught against New Delhi’s oil trade with Moscow.
